headline: CrowdStrike Stops Cloud Attacks in Seconds with Real-Time Cloud Detection and Response Innovations
summary: AUSTIN, Texas & LAS VEGAS, December 01, 2025--AWS re:Invent 2025 -- CrowdStrike (NASDAQ: CRWD) today unveiled new Cloud Detection and Response (CDR) innovations, advancing real-time protection across hybrid and multi-cloud environments. Powered by a new real-time detection engine built on streaming technology pioneered and battle-tested by the world’s top threat hunters, the enhanced CDR eliminates detection delays, surfacing high-fidelity alerts in seconds. headline: CrowdStrike Operationalizes and Secures Agentic AI Workloads on AWS
summary: AUSTIN, Texas & LAS VEGAS, December 01, 2025--AWS re:Invent 2025-- CrowdStrike (NASDAQ: CRWD) today announced at AWS re:Invent 2025 that it has achieved the Amazon Web Services (AWS) Agentic AI Specialization, a new category launched within the AWS AI Competency, as an inaugural launch partner.

content.title: CrowdStrike Operationalizes and Secures Agentic AI Workloads on AWS
content.summary: AUSTIN, Texas & LAS VEGAS, December 01, 2025--AWS re:Invent 2025-- CrowdStrike (NASDAQ: CRWD) today announced at AWS re:Invent 2025 that it has achieved the Amazon Web Services (AWS) Agentic AI Specialization, a new category launched within the AWS AI Competency, as an inaugural launch partner.

headline: CrowdStrike Advances Next-Gen SIEM and Cloud Security Access on AWS with Streamlined Onboarding, Flexible Pricing, and Cost-Efficient Data Access
summary: AUSTIN, Texas & LAS VEGAS, December 01, 2025--AWS re:Invent 2025 -- CrowdStrike (NASDAQ: CRWD), in collaboration with Amazon Web Services (AWS), today announced new integrations and consumption options in AWS Marketplace that make it even easier for customers to secure and operationalize workloads on AWS in an integrated, out-of-the box experience.

content.title: CrowdStrike Advances Next-Gen SIEM and Cloud Security Access on AWS with Streamlined Onboarding, Flexible Pricing, and Cost-Efficient Data Access
content.summary: AUSTIN, Texas & LAS VEGAS, December 01, 2025--AWS re:Invent 2025 -- CrowdStrike (NASDAQ: CRWD), in collaboration with Amazon Web Services (AWS), today announced new integrations and consumption options in AWS Marketplace that make it even easier for customers to secure and operationalize workloads on AWS in an integrated, out-of-the box experience.

headline: CrowdStrike Delivers Agentic Security to HPE Unleash AI Partner Program
summary: AUSTIN, Texas & BARCELONA, December 01, 2025--CrowdStrike (NASDAQ: CRWD) today announced that HPE has selected CrowdStrike for the HPE Unleash AI partner program, recognizing the AI-native CrowdStrike Falcon® platform for securing the agentic era. The collaboration integrates industry-leading protection from CrowdStrike into HPE Private Cloud AI, a turnkey AI factory co-developed with NVIDIA as part of NVIDIA AI Computing by HPE portfolio.

content.title: CrowdStrike Delivers Agentic Security to HPE Unleash AI Partner Program
content.summary: AUSTIN, Texas & BARCELONA, December 01, 2025--CrowdStrike (NASDAQ: CRWD) today announced that HPE has selected CrowdStrike for the HPE Unleash AI partner program, recognizing the AI-native CrowdStrike Falcon® platform for securing the agentic era. The collaboration integrates industry-leading protection from CrowdStrike into HPE Private Cloud AI, a turnkey AI factory co-developed with NVIDIA as part of NVIDIA AI Computing by HPE portfolio.

headline: Stocks Set to Open Lower as Bond Yields Climb, U.S. PCE Inflation Data Awaited
summary: December S&P 500 E-Mini futures (ESZ25) are down -0.57%, and December Nasdaq 100 E-Mini futures (NQZ25) are down -0.68% this morning, pointing to a lower open on Wall Street as Treasury yields climbed following hawkish comments from Bank of Japan Governor Kazuo Ueda.

content.title: Stocks Set to Open Lower as Bond Yields Climb, U.S. PCE Inflation Data Awaited
content.summary: December S&P 500 E-Mini futures (ESZ25) are down -0.57%, and December Nasdaq 100 E-Mini futures (NQZ25) are down -0.68% this morning, pointing to a lower open on Wall Street as Treasury yields climbed following hawkish comments from Bank of Japan Governor Kazuo Ueda.
